what a terrible idea. the fact that you see it on the system monitor means that it *is* running, but just frozen. kill it.
killall ktorrent  in a terminal. and don't go out of your way installing source tarballs just because a program locks up.

if you're seeing it on the system monitor, it's *not* been killed.
then why would you be seeing it on the system monitor? you mean *after* starting it then?
ok then kill it again and remove the ~/.kde/share/apps/ktorrent directory (careful, this will remove your downloads as well)
you won't lose them if they aren't in that folder i mentioned.
remove that folder. or rename it. type  mv ~/.kde/share/apps/ktorrent ~/ktorrent-backup
